About Me

Here's a little about me...


BIO

I am rising senior at the University of Kansas studying Computer Science. During my time in KU, I have interned at Young Innovations, Inc, and Brand New Box.

I have spent time developing my business and professional skills by being involved in the SELF and Vann fellowships on campus. I am very involved in Student Organizations, being the founder and president of KU's Suicide Awareness and Prevention club. I am also involved in KU's Entrepreneurship Club and Sigma Phi Epsilon.

Outside of school and programming, I spend most of my time listening to music, attending concerts and music festivals all over the country, and exercising. I also enjoy travelling, and I was fortunate to have the oportunity to spend my fall semester of my Junior year studying abroad in Sydney, Australia at Macquarie University.

Brand New Box

2020
Software Development Engineer Intern

I develop distributed, multi-tiered web applications using Ruby on Rails in my role at Brand New Box. I utilize Docker containers and Git repositories to facilitate team-based collaboration. I efficiently find solutions when given ambiguous problems and communicate technical challenges and solutions.

Young Innovations, Inc.

2019
Software Engineering Intern

I worked to maintain and improve a warehouse database primarily using SQL. I was also part of a team responsible for integrating new scanning software into the warehouse employee's workflow in order to accurately and sustainably maintain inventory data.

Mantis Merchandise

2019
Co-founder, CEO

I founded this company which aimed to manufacture and distribute merchandise for online social media influencers. I designed a website which hosted each influencer's store, and developed efficient processes to fulfill customer's orders and acquire new clients.
